sanavesa.net

Interface NetworkSerializable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DisconnectClientPacket

    public interface NetworkSerializable
extends java.io.Serializable
    The NetworkSerializable interface is the core of the networking data transmission. It provides an interface that implemented, allows the implementer to be sent over the network. The interface provides a default serialization and deserialization method, which can be overridden. It is extremely preferable to generate a serialVersionUID for the implementer. Moreover, this interface contains methods to handle the packet for both the client and the server.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Mohammad Alali
    See Also:
    Client, Server

      • handleOnClient

        default <T extends Client> void handleOnClient(T client)
        This method is invoked on the client side whenever this object is read by the client.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the class type of the client who received this object
        Parameters:
        client - - the client who read this serializable object
        Since:
        1.1
        See Also:

      • handleOnServer

        default <T extends Server> void handleOnServer(T server,
                                               ServerClient sender)
        This method is invoked on the server side whenever this object is read by the server.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the class type of the server who received this object
        Parameters:
        server - - the server who read this serializable object
        sender - - the client who sent this object
        Since:
        1.1
        See Also:
        Server

      • readObject

        default void readObject(java.io.ObjectInputStream in)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        This method provides the capability to override the default implementation of reading an object from the stream. The default implementation will serialize all non-transient, non-static fields.
        Parameters:
        in - - the stream to read from
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - thrown when any I/O errors occur
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - - thrown when the class read is not found anywhere in the class files
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ObjectInputStream

      • writeObject

        default void writeObject(java.io.ObjectOutputStream out)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method provides the capability to override the default implementation of writing an object to the stream. The default implementation will serialize all non-transient, non-static fields.
        Parameters:
        out - - the stream to write to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - thrown when any I/O errors occur
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ObjectOutputStream
